alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 10:33AM PST until February 24 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, the chance for snow showers is expected to arrive Wednesday afternoon. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches for elevations above 2000 ft. A dusting down to 1500 feet is possible through Thursday morning before snow showers taper off. For the Winter Storm Watch, chances for an additional 2 to 4 inches above 2000 feet is expected for the second round of snowfall from Thursday into Friday, with a light dusting down to 1500 feet. * WHERE...Above 1500 ft in the East Bay Hills. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, 10 AM PST Wednesday through 10 AM PST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, 10 AM PST Thursday through 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Slick, snow-covered roads and hiking trails. Hikers, campers, and outdoor enthusiasts may encounter dangerous winter- like conditions above the snow level. Heavier snow showers could produce limited visibilities. Downed trees and power outages possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The advisory covers only the initial onset of this storm. The watch that has been issued is for the second round of snow that is expected. Total snowfall for the Sonoma Coastal Range from Wednesday through Saturday morning is forecast to be between 3 to 6 inches, locally over 10 inches.
